ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What will convey to you what Saqar is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: What do you think Hell-fire is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And what do you know what Hell is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Would that you really knew what hell is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And what have you understood, what hell is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And what will make you know (exactly) what Saqar is
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And what will make you realize what hell is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and what will teach thee what is Sakar?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: - Ah, what will convey unto thee what that burning is! -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What could make you conceive what hell-fire is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And what knoweth thou that which the Scorching Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And what will show you what is Saqar?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And what will explain to thee what Hell-Fire is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And what will make you know exactly what Hell-fire is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What will let you know what the Scorching is like!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But what will explain to you what Saqar is?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:27] And how would you know what is Saqar? — this [interrogative] is intended to emphasise its enormity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 707 (Ah, what will convey unto thee) Muhammad (what that burning is!
